instruction: What modifications were made to the ResNet network in the proposed detection method for leguminivora glycinivorella matsumura pest in soybean?
Output: In the proposed detection method for leguminivora glycinivorella matsumura pest in soybean, the ResNet network was modified by combining it with Attention. This combination allowed for obtaining feature vectors that could better express the samples, thereby improving the performance of the model. Additionally, the traditional Batch Normalization was replaced by Layer Normalization to enhance the training stability of the model and the prediction performance on the testing set.

instruction: Can the A-ResNet meta-learning model be used as a superior alternative to traditional detection methods for accurately and efficiently detecting the leguminivora glycinivorella matsumura pest in soybean?
Output: Yes, the A-ResNet meta-learning model can be used as a superior alternative to traditional detection methods for accurately and efficiently detecting the leguminivora glycinivorella matsumura pest in soybean. The model combines the ResNet network with Attention to obtain feature vectors that better express the samples, improving the performance of the model. Additionally, the classifier is designed as a multi-class support vector machine (SVM) to reduce overfitting. The use of Layer Normalization instead of Batch Normalization and the Label Smooth method further enhance the training stability and prediction performance of the model. The experimental results showed that the A-ResNet meta-learning model achieved an accuracy of 94.57 +/- 0.19%, enabling rapid and accurate nondestructive detection of the pest. This provides theoretical support for the intelligent detection of soybean pests.
